findings.title: Reentrancy
findings.description: The finalizeRedeem function does not follow checks effects interaction patterns where an external call is made in internal function _finalizeRedeem() and an attacker contract can reenter the finalizeRedeem function again to get same EvmosAmount on the same RedeemInfo in userRedeems that has not yet been deleted.

findings.title: Centralization Risks / Overpowered Ownership
findings.description: Without clear documentation if the Ownable contract will make use of decentralised control such as MultiSig. The owner has control to update whitelists, update redeem settings, upgrade contracts. Any compromise to the Owner account may allow the hacker to take advantage of this.

findings.title: State variable never initialised and or updated in the contracts or used in any other functionality
findings.description: The state variable 'mapping(address => uint256) private _farmStakingBalances;' is declared but never used or updated in the contract, which may indicate missing logic.

findings.title: Floating pragma
findings.description: Contracts make use of pragma ^0.8.0 which allows for variable solidity compiler versions. This can result in different versions being used for testing and production.

findings.title: Order Layout
findings.description: The ordering and layout of functions, constructors, variables and general layout of the Solidity files may need to be changed.
